result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Jeremy J. Lynch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.
*   Pay fine of $250 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Pay DNA surcharge.
No violent contact with Tiffany L, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy J. Lynch

records.addlTxt: Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on September 29, 2015 at 08:45 am.
09-22-15 Deferred Prosecution Agreement rescheduled to 09-29-15 at 8:45 am by The Court.
Waiver of Rights
Stipulated Hold Open Agreement on Count 1.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Kevin Noonan.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Amended Information filed charging Ct 1 - False Imprisonment, Domestic Abuse (felony), Ct 2 - Negligent Operation of a Vehicle, and Ct 3 - Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse.  Pleas of guilty entered to all 3 counts.  Count 1 - Def. found guilty by the court but entry of judgment is withheld.  Hold Open Agreement for 12 months.  Counts 2 and 3 - Def. found guilty by the Court; judgment entered.  Sentences withheld, placed on probation for 12 months w/conditions.  If def. successfully completes probation in Counts 2 and 3, State will recommend Count 1 be dismissed.  Status conf. re Count 1 on 9/22/15 at 8:30.  Bond continued.

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Violent Contact w/Tiffany L or her residence
941.30(2) - 2nd degree recklessly endangering safety DV  /  940.30 - False imprisonment DV  /  947.01(1) - DC DV

Defendant, Jeremy J. Lynch, appeared with Attorney Kevin T. Noonan.  Attorney Jason Robert Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 7.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond arguments heard; victim in court and spoke on the issue; The Court modifies the conditions of the bond to no violent contact with the victim, all other conditions continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
